algorithm_technique: Number theory: Group indices by their square-free part. Sum elements within each group to find the maximum sum.
problem_summary_simple: Find the maximum sum of elements whose indices' product is a perfect square.
problem_summary_technical: Group indices by their square-free part. Sum elements for each group; the maximum sum is the answer.
key_insights: The core idea is that if `i * j` is a perfect square, then `i` and `j` must have the same square-free part.
The square-free part of a number `n` is obtained by dividing `n` by all its perfect square factors.
We can iterate through all possible square-free parts and sum up the elements at indices that share that square-free part.
